name: Stewed Red Cabbage
keywords: apple, pear, red cabbage, fall, side dish
recipeIngredient: 2 pounds red cabbage, cored and finely shredded
2 McIntosh or Granny Smith apples, peeled, cored and grated
1 large Bartlett pear, peeled, cored and grated
1 tablespoon salt, plus more to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Place cabbage in a large pot. Add onion, apples and pear. Place cloves and peppercorns on a double layer of cheesecloth and tie with string to make a bag. Add the bag and all the remaining ingredients to the pot. Cover and refrigerate overnight.

Place pot, uncovered, over medium-low heat. Bring liquid to a simmer. Simmer, stirring occasionally, until cabbage is tender and liquid has reduced and thickened, about 2 hours. Remove bag, cinnamon stick and bay leaf. Add salt to taste. Serve hot.
